result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Matthew M. Crangle

records.addlTxt:
9:24 AM Attorney Daniel Joseph Tombasco in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Matthew M. Crangle in court.  Attorney Robert William Keller in court for Matthew M. Crangle. Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES: 22CF699/22CF1152. Victim rights compliance. Victim is present in court today. Attorney Keller is requesting another final pretrial as he still needs to request and review the discovery for Case 22CF1152. The State does not object to the request for an adjournment. Attorney Keller makes a verbal motion to amend the bond to allow contact with the victim. Arguments heard. Court denies verbal bond motion for reasons set forth on the record.
Final pre-trial scheduled for December 15, 2022 at 10:30 am.

**AMENDED**

PROPER ATTIRE REQUIRED.  NO SHORTS OR TANK TOPS ALLOWED IN COURTROOM.
*Contact between DE and Marna N. re: children or financial matters is permitted through electronic means ONLY - i.e. text message, email. *No discussion of case or talk of reunification is permitted. *DE shall not consume alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription. *DE shall not be in bars, taverns, or liquor stores.

10:38 AM  Attorney Dan Tombasco appeared for the State. DE appears in person with Atty Robert Keller. Victim present in court. Clerk P. Scypta.  
MINUTES:   Victim rights compliance. Motion to modify bond. Atty Keller reports DE has undertaken counseling and requests no contact orders be lifted. Statement from victim. ST objects. Discussion held. Court modifies bond to permit contact through electronic means only with victim re: children or financial issues only. No discussion of case or talk of reunification.  DE shall not consume alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription. DE shall not be in bars, taverns or liquor stores.
Motion hearing on September 19, 2022 at 10:30 am.
to Lift NC Order

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Daniel Tombasco appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person along w/Atty Robert Keller.  VRC.  Case isn't resolved yet; defense counsel requests a date in October.  Deft in counseling at Oakwood.  No objection from the State.  FPT 10/14/22 @ 9am.

Defendant, Matthew M. Crangle, appeared with Attorney Robert William Keller.  State appears by Attorney Alexandra Smathers.    Clerk JT  Minutes:    DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found.  Bound over.   Information filed; reading waived.   DE requests substitution of Br 3; Br 2 assigned.  Not guilty plea entered. Scheduling Order completed and given to Attorney.  DE motion to modify bond; arguments heard; Court modifies the $2500 signature bond to allow 3rd party contact for pick up and drop off of children and electronic and 3rd party contact re:children; all other conditions remain the same.  (see bond event)    Judicial Pretrial - in court scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 10:00 am.
